intro: Asclepias tuberosa, commonly known as the milkweed or butterfly weed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its bright orange flowers and is part of the Apocynaceae family. The plant has thick, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine绒毛. It produces a milky sap that contains cardiac glycosides, which are toxic to many animals. Asclepias tuberosa plays a vital role in supporting monarch butterfly populations by providing nectar and serving as a host plant for their larvae.
